page.title: 06KNOCKERDOWN INN RECREATION
page.content: This public house is located on the B5035 Ashbourne to Wirksworth road. It is the only public house in the surveyed area. This was formerly called the Greyhound Inn and has been in existence over 200 years. The landlord is Mr.John Bloor who is a tenant to Marstons Brewery and has been at the Knockerdown for two years. The Inn serves beer straight from the cask, Marston's Pedigree and Merry Monk Mild Beer. Also they serve Marston's Lager, draught Guiness, Woodpecker Cider, spirits, bottled beers, fruit juices and minerals. {Food}is served on the premises. There are plated meals and snacks (all home-made) including steak & kidney pie, meat and potato pie, chilli, lasagne, and the house speciality - the 'Knock Pot' a beef stew in beer
